src:
Tres turistes, el seu guia i un guàrdia de seguretat, apunyalats en un jaciment romà a Jordània
La policia ha detingut el presumpte agressor. Dos dels ferits estan en estat crític

06 Nov 2019, 10:55

Tres turistes, el seu guia i un vigilant de seguretat han estat apunyalats aquest dimecres al jaciment romà de Gerasa, al nord-est de Jordània. La policia ha informat que ha detingut el presumpte agressor. No se sap per ara quin és l'estat dels ferits.
Inicialment s'havia informat que es tractava de turistes espanyols, però el diari oficial jordà Al Ra'i ha dit posteriorment que són de nacionalitat mexicana. Fonts de l'hospital on han sigut traslladats els ferits citades per aquest diari diuen que dos dels turistes ferits estan en estat crític.
text:
Three tourists, their guide and a security guard, stabbed in a Roman site in Jordan
Police arrested alleged suspect. Two of the injured are in critical condition

06 Nov 2019, 10:55

Three tourists, their guide and a security guard have been stabbed this Wednesday at the Roman site of Gerasa, northeast of Jordan. The police have reported that the suspected aggressor has been arrested. It is not known at this time what is the condition of the injured.
Initially it was reported that it was Spanish tourists, but the official Jordanian newspaper Al Ra'i later said that they are of Mexican nationality. Sources of the hospital where the injured were quoted in this newspaper say two of the injured tourists are in critical condition.
